results.title: Mozzie [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jane Keneally and Dylan Yeo
results.brief_description: As a man tries to sleep two animated mosquitoes buzz around him, attending to the business of blood sucking and fending off insect repellent in the process. A short film that effectively mixes live action with computer animation to convey the themes of global warming, the effect of chloro fluorocarbons and alternative therapy in brain surgery.

results.title: Mozzie
results.creator_credit: Dylan Yeo, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Spectacular animation about fluorocarbons, global warming and radical brain surgery. An evil entrepreneur discovers the real price of his actions. Combined live action and computer animation. Written, directed and animated by Dylan Yeo. Original format 35mm/colour.

results.title: Mozart: Symphony No. 41 in C Major, Menuetto Allegretto (3rd Movement)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion Series”.
A series of abstrzct scenes of nature in a variety of rhythms, moods and tempos give added significance to the music in Mozart’s Minuet from the “Jupiter” Symphony.

results.title: Mozart in Salzburg
results.creator_credit: Francis Hitching Productions, Profilm, Francis Hitching and Barrie Gavin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Composers”.
Biographical film on the life of one of the world’s greatest composers, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, born in 1756 in Salzburg, Austria. The brilliance and genius of Mozart is still appreciated and interpreted today by musicians worldwide. Features the Salzburg Mozarteum Orchestra in this specially staged concert program, conducted by Ralph Weikert and distinguished broadcaster and musicologist Antony Hopkins who provides an introduction to each concert piece, including a brief account of Mozart’s life from childhood to adulthood.

results.title: Mozart in Delphi
results.creator_credit: Don Philps and Robert L Allnutt
results.brief_description: This is a film of a journey to the source of Western civilisation in the ruins of the historical site at Delphi. The music of the Classic Greeks has not survived but in the form and harmony of Mozart’s music the Apollonian concepts are given complete expression. In 1985, the Australian Chamber Orchestra travelled to Greece to perform in Athens and at Delphi as part of the Cultural Capital of Europe Festival 1985 to honour this classic heritage. Rated: G

results.title: Mozart and his music
results.brief_description: The film traces the development of Mozart’s music at different periods in his life by showing the people and places which probably influenced his music; the house in Salzburg where he was born; scenes in Rome, Milan and Naples where he was acclaimed a boy genius; and Vienna where he later lived and composed some of his most important works. Excerpts from the following are included in the film: the Overture to the “Marriage of Figaro”; the First, Second and Third Movements of the Piano Concerto No. 23; the “Requiem” from the Requiem Mass; the Overture and “Batti, batti” aria from “Don Giovanni”; and the Allegro Movement from the Piano Sonata in C. Major.

results.title: Mowgli's brothers
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones Enterprises, Xerox Films and Chuck Jones
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Kipling classic from ‘The jungle books’”.
Animated version of Kipling’s classic tale of a boy rescued and raised by wolves in the jungles of India comes alive in this film about love, justice and loyalty. Features the voices of Roddy McDowall and June Foray. Teacher’s notes accompany the video. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
